alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Dubuque; Jackson; Jones (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 23 at 2:31AM CDT until July 23 at 3:15AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Jackson County in east central Iowa... Southwestern Dubuque County in northeastern Iowa... Northern Jones County in east central Iowa... Southeastern Delaware County in northeastern Iowa... * Until 315 AM CDT. * At 230 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Langworthy, or near Anamosa, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Anamosa, Monticello, Cascade, Onslow, Monmouth, Bernard, Center Junction, Nashville, Langworthy, Canton, Baldwin, Emeline, South Gary Owen, Garry Owen, Fillmore, Maquoketa Caves State Park, Ironhills, Washington Mills, Monticello Municipal Airport and Jones County Fairgrounds. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building.
